net.fathomsoft.nova.tree

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArgumentList, Assignment, Condition, Dimensions, ElseStatement, Exception, ExceptionHandler, ExternalStatement, ExternalTypeList, FieldList, FileDeclaration, IfStatement, Import, ImportList, InstanceFieldList, Loop, LoopInitialization, LoopUpdate, MethodList, ParameterList, Program, Scope, StaticFieldList, Value, VariableDeclarationList

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that is the parent of all Nodes on the Tree. Keeps the basic information of where the statement was in the source, and where it was output in the destination file. A Node can have any number of children, however some of the extensions of Node have default children at the start.
    Since:
    v0.1 Jan 5, 2014 at 9:00:11 PM
    Version:
    v0.2.14 Jun 18, 2014 at 10:11:40 PM
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

        public final boolean isEmpty()
        Get whether or not the specified Node has had no custom Nodes added to it. I.e. It is in its default state. I.e. It is in its post-initialization state.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the specified Node has had no custom Nodes added to it.

      • pendingScopeFragment

        public boolean pendingScopeFragment()
        Get whether or not the specified Node is waiting for a single statement to add as a child.

        For example: 
         // Scenario 1
 if (true)
 {
        execute();
 }
 
 // Scenario 2
 if (true) execute();
        In scenario 2, before the execute() method call was decoded, the if statement node was pending a scope fragment.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the specified Node is waiting for a single statement to add as a child.

        The line number in which the Node was decoded at.

      • iterateWords

        public final Node.ExtraData iterateWords(java.lang.String statement)
        Iterate through the words of the statement. A word is just anything that is surrounded by whitespace. e.g. In the statement: "public void test() { }" the words consist of: [ public, void, test(), {, } ]
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to iterate the words from.
        Returns:
        The given ExtraData instance.

      • iterateWords

        public final Node.ExtraData iterateWords(java.lang.String statement,
                          Node.ExtraData extra)
        Iterate through the words of the statement. A word is just anything that is surrounded by whitespace. e.g. In the statement: "public void test() { }" the words consist of: [ public, void, test(), {, } ]
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to iterate the words from.
        extra - The extra data that may or may not be needed for the interactWord() methods.
        Returns:
        The given ExtraData instance.

      • iterateWords

        public final Node.ExtraData iterateWords(java.lang.String statement,
                          java.util.regex.Pattern pattern)
        Iterate through each of the groupings of the given Pattern on the statement. In the default case, it will search for the boundaries of words and iterate through all of them.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to search through.
        pattern - The Pattern to search with.
        Returns:
        The given ExtraData instance.

      • iterateWords

        public Node.ExtraData iterateWords(java.lang.String statement,
                          java.util.regex.Pattern pattern,
                          Node.ExtraData extra)
        Iterate through each of the groupings of the given Pattern on the statement. In the default case, it will search for the boundaries of words and iterate through all of them.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement to search through.
        pattern - The Pattern to search with.
        extra - The extra data that may or may not be needed for the interactWord() methods.
        Returns:
        The given ExtraData instance.

      • interactWord

        public void interactWord(java.lang.String word,
                int wordNumber,
                Bounds bounds,
                int numWords,
                java.lang.String leftDelimiter,
                java.lang.String rightDelimiter,
                Node.ExtraData extra)
        Method that is to be overridden. Whenever the iterateWords(String) method is called, this method will be called with the specific word and the number (order) the word came in the statement.
        Parameters:
        word - The word that was found.
        wordNumber - The index of the word on a word-by-word basis.
        bounds - The bounds of the word that was found.
        numWords - The number of words that were parsed.
        leftDelimiter - The text that is between the previous word and the current word.
        rightDelimiter - The text that is between the current word and the next word.
        extra - The extra data that may or may not be needed for the interactWord() methods.

        public java.lang.String generateJavaSource()

        The Java syntax representation of the Node.

      • generateNovaInput

        public final java.lang.StringBuilder generateNovaInput()
        Generate the Nova syntax String that represents the Node. Essentially, this is the String that is decoded into the node. It is the input value from the .fat source file.
        Returns:
        The appended StringBuilder that represents the input String in Nova syntax.

      • generateNovaInput

        public final java.lang.StringBuilder generateNovaInput(boolean outputChildren)
        Generate the Nova syntax String that represents the Node. Essentially, this is the String that is decoded into the node. It is the input value from the .nova source file.
        Parameters:
        outputChildren - Whether or not to output the children of the children of the Node as well.
        Returns:
        The appended StringBuilder that represents the input String in Nova syntax.

      • generateNovaInput

        public final java.lang.StringBuilder generateNovaInput(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Generate the Nova syntax String that represents the Node. Essentially, this is the String that is decoded into the node. It is the input value from the .nova source file.
        Parameters:
        builder - The StringBuilder to append the data to.
        Returns:
        The appended StringBuilder that represents the input String in Nova syntax.

      • generateNovaInput

        public java.lang.StringBuilder generateNovaInput(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                                        boolean outputChildren)
        Generate the Nova syntax String that represents the Node. Essentially, this is the String that is decoded into the node. It is the input value from the .nova source file.
        Parameters:
        outputChildren - Whether or not to output the children of the children of the Node as well.
        builder - The StringBuilder to append the data to.
        Returns:
        The appended StringBuilder that represents the input String in Nova syntax.

        The nearest ClassDeclaration instance that contains this node.

      • getParentMethod

        public final MethodDeclaration getParentMethod()
        Get the Method parent instance of the Node, if one exists.
        Returns:
        The nearest Method instance that contains this node.

      • getParentMethod

        public final MethodDeclaration getParentMethod(boolean inclusive)
        Get the Method parent instance of the Node, if one exists.
        Parameters:
        inclusive - Whether or not to inclusively check the specified Node to see if it is a MethodDeclaration.
        Returns:
        The nearest Method instance that contains this node.

      • getController

        public Nova getController()
        Get the compiler's controller. The controller is used for logging, error output, and other compiler options.
        Returns:
        The compiler's controller instance.

      • decodeScopeFragment

        public boolean decodeScopeFragment(java.lang.String statement,
                          Bounds bounds)
        Decode a scope fragment for the Node, if needed.

        For example: 
         // Scenario 1
 if (true)
 {
        execute();
 }
 
 // Scenario 2
 if (true) execute();
        In scenario 2, before the execute() method call was the scope fragment.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement containing the scope fragment.
        bounds - The bounds of the Node's arguments.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the scope fragment decoded correctly.

      • clone

        public abstract Node clone(Node temporaryParent,
         Location locationIn)
        Return a new Node containing a copy of the values of the specified node, including clones of the children.
        Parameters:
        temporaryParent - The Node to act as the parent temporarily.
        locationIn - The Location instance holding the information.
        Returns:
        A clone of the specified Node.

      • cloneTo

        public Node cloneTo(Node node)
        Fill the given Node with the data that is in the specified node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to copy the data into.
        Returns:
        The cloned node.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generate a String that represents the Node as how it was decoded.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The Nova input equivalent to the node.

      • test

        public static java.lang.String test()
        Test the Node class type to make sure everything is working properly.
        Returns:
        The error output, if there was an error. If the test was successful, null is returned.
